alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 09 at 8:29AM CST until February 10 at 2:25PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County. Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Gravelly affecting Yell County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Fourche Lafave River Near Gravelly. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Portions of Highway 28 effected. Timber and pasture along West Bank floods. Property and livestock should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CST Thursday the stage was 24.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 4.2 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 6 AM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Crest Time Date Fourche Lafave R Gravelly 24.0 24.7 Thu 7 AM 7.7 6.3 5.4 Falling &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
